title: ICEBERG_TABLE_SNAPSHOT_REFRESH_HISTORY | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
Returns metadata and snapshot information about the most recent
refresh history for a specified externally managed Apache Iceberg™ table.
Apache Iceberg™ tables , Metadata and retention for Apache Iceberg™ tables , ALTER ICEBERG TABLE … REFRESH

The name of the externally managed Iceberg table
for which you want to retrieve the snapshot refresh history.
The function returns the following columns:
The timestamp when the table was last refreshed.
The full path to the metadata file.
The snapshot ID of the last refresh.
The sequence number of the last refresh; NULL for Iceberg v1.
The schema ID of the refresh (from metadata).

The ID of the query that performed the refresh.
For tables that use automated refresh,
this column contains a sentinel value, which indicates that the refresh was automated.
TRUE if the table is refreshed on this snapshot; otherwise, FALSE.
The Iceberg snapshot summary from the metadata.json file. NULL if not present in the metadata file.
Retrieve information for the current version of an externally managed Iceberg table named my_iceberg_table:
